alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, east central Putnam, southwestern Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sissonville, or 9 miles northeast of Nitro, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Sissonville, Poca, Cross Lanes, Elkview, and Pinch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 3 and 15. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 105 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central, western and northwestern West Virginia.
